subject: Physical Fitness
title: Acute vs Chronic Injuries
description: A fast breakdown of Acute vs Chronic Injuries for builders.

hook.text: A sudden ankle twist is one kind of injury. A knee aching for months is another. They work very differently.

buildup.text: Acute injuries happen in an instant â€” a fall, a collision, a sudden wrong movement. They're traumatic events.

discovery.text: Chronic injuries develop gradually from repeated stress over time. They're called overuse injuries.

twist.text: Most fitness injuries are chronic, not acute. It's rarely one bad rep â€” it's months of accumulated overload.

climax.text: Understanding the type determines the solution. Acute injuries need rest. Chronic injuries need load management.

punchline.text: Today's injury was building for weeks. Most fitness injuries are slow burns.

quiz.question: What type of injury is most common in fitness settings?
